pair.Prompt: On March 15, 1889, the Trans-Missouri Freight Association was formed by several railway companies.
pair.Response: Response: The agreement between the railway companies stated that the purpose of the association was to "establish and maintain reasonable rates, rules and regulations on all freight traffic, both through and local." The agreement was made illegal on the passage of the act of July 2, 1890, which prohibited contracts in restraint of interstate or foreign trade or commerce. The fourth section of the act gave the government full power and authority to bring a suit against the association.
